results.title: Glaciers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Understanding Our Earth”.
Shows the formation of many different types glaciers and describes the effect of glacial action as seen in the lakes of the Rockies, soil in the American Corn Belt, glacial drift in new England, and the Matterhorn peak in the Swiss Alps.

results.title: Glacier on the move
results.brief_description: Shows a glacier in action, illustrating the rhythm of glacial movement in summer and winter, and the effects of gravity, temperature and pressure on glacial movement.

results.title: Glaciation
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rene Jodoin, Frank Spiller and Kenneth McCready
results.brief_description: Today only remnants remains of the great ice sheets that once covered North America, but the glaciers found in the Canadian Artic and mountain regions are still one of the most unusual elements of our natural environment and an amazing repository of geological history. This colour film, suitable for the classroom, shows the surprising life and activity of glaciers

results.title: Giving oral medications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Stresses the importance and demonstrates the correct procedure for giving the right amount of the right medicine at the right time to the right patient.

results.title: Giving an enema
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Discusses two main types of enemas, retention and evacuant, and demonstrates the procedure for giving them. Emphasises the importance of after-care of the patient and sterilization of equipment.

results.title: Giving a shop demonstration
results.brief_description: An example of good teaching practise in the school workshop and materials are assembled in preparation for the class; a demonstration by the instructor precedes practical work by students; the instruction demonstrates and explains proper methods to be used; questions are asked by the teacher and the students during the course of the work.

results.title: Given a chance
results.brief_description: This is a video which focusses on the life experiences of refugee young people in australia. The video is divided into two sections: Section one explores the refugee experience from the perspective of 5 young who have resettled in Australia from the countries of El Salvador, Vietnam, Afghanistan, Cambodia and Eritrea. It is relevant to both workers and young people. Section two explores issues for service providers and contains interviews with experienced workers with refugee young people. The video can be used in education and training of both young people and professionals working with refugee young people. Includes video training notes.

results.title: Given a chance
results.creator_credit: Barwon Youth Employment Office for the Employment Access Program, Community Services Victoria and Clayton Jacobson
results.brief_description: A program targeting employers, CES, welfare and youth workers assisting disadvantaged youth in the labour market. A positive image of such job seekers is promoted through interviews with young people and employers regarding their success. Provides background information about Victorian Juvenile Justice and Protective Services in relation to employing young people. Explains the role of the Employment Access Program.

results.title: Give yourself the green light
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the inadequacy of roads in the United States and illustrates measures to improve roads and relieve traffic congestion; municipal parking lots; express ways through crowded cities; cross-country super-highways; cloverleaf’s in various section of the country; cities and States matching federal grants for road construction and maintenance.
